QL- Custom Technology Limited is a professional company that specializes in Custom made Over molding cable assembly and wire harnesses. Overmolded cables are full assemblies that combine the wire and connector into one single, seamless piece. To do this, the cable assembly is placed inside a mold. Next, molten plastic material is injected into the mold cavity. QL-Custom operates in a modern facility that houses warehousing, engineering, production, and important support activities at hand to satisfy all our customers. Superior product line The range of products in the plastic molding category includes GPS position track devices, vacuum cleaner parts, outdoor/indoor parts, speaker frames, molded connectors, and sockets, as well as other plastic products. Our cable products have grown in popularity to make us a world-class supplier of important items including custom molded cable, automotive wire harness, solar cables, and other wire solutions customized for individual customers. QL-Custom will work with clients throughout the entire process to produce the designs you desire to your specifications. The quality department will analyze all products using advanced testing apparatus before we quickly deliver the parts to your preferred destination. We certainly have the ability and capacity to meet virtually any needs you might have with regards to plastic molding and cable harness, relying on our time-tested quality workforce to assure products that will never let you down.

Custom Molded Cables

From extreme environmental stresses to the strains of abrasion and high-repetition movement, molded cable assemblies must be built to last. Without rigorous attention to the demands found in the field, a single cable assembly can lead to downtime, lost productivity, and decreased ROI. That’s why Cypress Industries ensures that each custom cable assembly is designed, manufactured, and tested according to the strictest specifications.

We review all of the demands imposed on each cable assembly and bring a wealth of options to the table. After choosing the right materials (we work with PVC, rubber, Santoprene, ABS, Polycarbonate (PC), Macromelt, and many others) we identify the best production processes. Each stage of pre molding, potting and overmolding is reviewed. We provide the right mix of waterproofing and abrasion resistance, meeting IP67 and IP68 standards if necessary. Soldering and crimp joints are examined, and remolding, overmolding, or both can be incorporated to secure the connections and provide strain relief, durability, and long, useful life. We can design custom potting fixtures machined in specific shapes, adding coatings to the potting fixtures to ensure a good release and a clean finish. We also provide potting of junction boxes to provide weatherproof seals.

Benefits of overmolding
To do this, the cable assembly is placed inside a mold. The first material (the substrate) is covered by the other materials in this process. Our skilled engineering and sales reception capabilities on industrial cable assemblies can respond quickly to customer inquiries, like Military connectors, Aviation Connectors these industrial cables. We assist in developing different cabling quality requirements in accordance with IPC620 industry standards. Fully work with your engineers, we can develop a product from an idea to a job as well as to meet the mass production of the customer.

Overmolded cable assembly internal components fortify protective qualities and help cable assemblies survive in even the most rugged environments. By overmolding your cable assemblies, you will:
• Increase the flexibility at the cable exit, where most of the movement between a cable and connector takes place
• Provide resistance to abrasion and shock or impact
• Make cable assemblies tamper-proof by encapsulating components beneath a sealed resin
• Provide 360-degree strain relief and increased pull strength
• Create a water-resistant or water-tight seal that qualifies cable assemblies for IP certification
• Improve the overall quality, appearance, and feel of cable assemblies, replacing the need for expensive metal backshells
• Simplify installation by creating a one-piece assembly with keys that act as visual indicators to assist in the mating of each pair
• Reduce human error

Cable Assembly Overmoldering Process

The over-molding of a cable assembly is accomplished by forcing material into a mold cavity under a great deal of pressure. For cable assemblies, the most popular materials used for an overmold are thermoplastic or thermoset materials. The injection molding machine, also known as a press, consists of a storage area for the mold resin. Sometimes it can be called a hopper. Delivery for the material is usually an injection ram or a screw-type plunger enclosed inside a metal tube also known as a barrel. Heating elements are installed into the barrel of the machine causing the mold resin to be heated to a molten state.

The process begins with the resin specified for the mold being fed into the heated barrel of the molding machine at the hopper end. It is then mixed with any desired colorants and transits the length of the barrel to the actual mold where the resin and colorant mixture is forced into the mold cavities. Once inside the mold cavity, the material will cool taking on any features designed into the mold itself including logos, trade names, or part numbers.

Molded strain relief

Strain relief is a standard fixture for electrical cables that functions as a feature for relieving the stress from the cable connections themselves to prevent them from breaking. It is located in the base of the connector where the connector meets the cable and usually comes pre-molded as part of the connector itself. It is the part of the connector that looks like a sleeve over the cable and is often segmented to allow some limited bending without problems.

On other cables, especially those that are manufactured separate from their connectors, strain relief often comes in the form of a separate device that is installed over the connector and the cable joint. In the case of network cables, the strain relief is called the “boot,” which is fitted over the connector after attaching the cable and the RJ-45 connector. In other connectors, the strain relief can be in the form of metallic connectors and grips, some of them made of metal that is crimped over the cable to provide tensile strength.

We understand the challenges and trends cutting across the electrical design processes across the world and our engineers are always ready to walk with you in this process. Our valuable integration resource saves time and costs for global customers thanks to an effective engineering team that is skilled and meticulous, always dedicated to delivering products that meet the highest standards as stipulated by industry standards. You are assured of a quick production process that is executed to precision.

Wire insulation is typically available in vinyl, nylon, and heat shrink.  Non-insulated terminals provide much more economic value with their low cost. Also, they are commonly used when extra protection is unnecessary.

When purchasing various wire terminals, make sure that your purchase meets industry standards and project requirements.

Wire harnesses are a mixture of wires that are bundled together to form a wire harness. Wire harnesses range in complexity from a few individual wires going point to point to hundreds of individual wires, multiconductor cables, and welded wires all forming a complex wire harness used to transmit power and all types of data.

Wire harness designs are highly customizable, as harnesses are typically designed to suit specific applications. They may need to be concealed behind walls, fit within electrical boxes, or conform to other space constraints. Precise measurements of the environment, power demand, and lengths must be taken during design to prevent costly mistakes and ensure the proper safety and functionality of the final product.

The harness must fit neatly in its intended space. For example, harnesses in vehicles are very compact to ensure they can fit within the small electrical boxes contained within cars. Outer protective casing size must be taken into consideration.

Wire harnesses often require intricate construction design with mechanical fastening, over-moulded connectors, grommets, strain reliefs, and ultrasonic welds. Types of terminals and how they fit the wire radius are critical decisions during the design.

 

FAQ

 

Q1: What is a wire harness, and how is it different from a wiring harness or cable assembly?

A wire harness, also known as a wiring harness or cable assembly, is a collection of wires or cables bound together with protective coverings. While the terms are often used interchangeably, subtle differences may exist. Wire assemblies generally refer to the organized grouping of wires, typically enclosed in protective sheaths, designed for easy implementation into equipment and systems.

Q2: What are the primary applications of wire harnesses and cable assemblies?

Wire harnesses and cable assemblies have diverse applications across industries such as automotive, consumer electronics, telecommunications, medical equipment, clean energy, and more. They play a crucial role in organizing and protecting electric wires, ensuring reliable connectivity and efficient system functionality.

title.rendered: Why we are best in cable assembly companies?

content.rendered:
Cable assemblies are a group of wires covered by more intensive exterior products. It is a group of cables that have been cut to a specific length and bundled together in a precise orientation to make assembly and installation easier. The cable assembly supplier can bind it together using tape or cable ties, or a sleeve can be placed over top to keep the cables together. The cable assembly companies created specifically for the application are a valuable solution for OEMs across a range of different sectors such as Industrial, Medical, Automotive, Marine and Security. Cable assembly used for a variety of businesses from all industries that require the use of electronic equipment have needs for cable assemblies. Because cable assemblies are designed to hold and organize many different electrical wires safely, they can be used in a variety of indoor and outdoor settings. Cable assemblies protect technicians and contractors from the potential hazards of an electrical current. They also protect external materials that could be harmed by electricity or materials that could conduct electricity, thereby causing harm to bystanders. Wire harnesses allow electricians to easily navigate electrical systems. They keep the wiring in a highly organized configuration, which helps technicians to avoid a time-consuming analysis of how the systemic components fit together. Cable assemblies also serve as a protection for the wires and cables housed within their sheaths. They guard the wiring against wear and tear, harsh environmental conditions, and other incidental damage.

To perform higher standards the benefits that cable assemblies can provide to manufacturers and customers alike.

● Safety
● Service life
● Space
● Customizable

The cable assembly companies provide safe consolidation of potentially dangerous electrical wiring. They allow electricians to keep the wiring well-organized and simultaneously protect the wiring from outside elements. Wire harnesses keep cables from becoming tangled or bent and also protect them from exposure to harmful environmental factors. This improves the ultimate life of the cables. The Wire harnesses keep cables from becoming tangled or bent and also protect them from exposure to harmful environmental factors. This improves the ultimate life of the cables.
Cable assemblies help manufacturers to optimize the space inside of electronics to provide additional room for other parts and components. Even if additional space isn’t required, wire harnesses still decrease clutter caused by individual loose cables. And Customized cable assemblies often support specific functionality in products.

The major cable assembly uses are transmitting information signals or power. Cable assembly is normally designed for environmental factors. The major services included are Cutting and preparing wires. Our fully automatic Komax 255 and wire processing machines cut, strip, tin dip and crimp single or multi-core wires. Crimped cable assemblies thus we hold a vast range of automatic connector and crimp tooling for all major manufacturers including TE Connectivity, Molex, Amphenol, JST, ITT Cannon, DEUTSCH and Hirose. And Cable looms and harness assembly. Applications range from simple panel wiring to complex interconnect harnesses for a wide range of industries including the Industrial, Automotive, Medical and Marine sectors.

The type of cable assemblies includes a variety of options in cable assemblies manufacturing such as multi-conductor, coaxial/RF, wire and cable harnesses, complex military, flat ribbon, custom electro-mechanical, and more. Although there are similarities, there are variations as well. Among harness, assemblies are different types, one being basic. Depending on the exact product, this might include only three discreet components whereas a classic type harness could be designed with several more, as well as various other components that are passive or possibly active. Usually, there are dozens of wires and in some instances, hundreds of unique terminations and components. The most urgent and much-needed five cable assemblies are; Military Grade Cable Assemblies, There are several strict requirements for cable assemblies marked as military-grade, and a separate set of requirements for the connectors on your cables and the wires used in the assembly. Additionally, the use of the cable assembly is taken into account; the requirements for cable assemblies that will be used in underwater environments are t from those used on planes. Military-grade cable assemblies are often required for field communication links, airborne systems, remote weapons control, marine systems, military ground equipment, and inter-shelter communications. RF/EMI Cable Assemblies,
RFI is radio frequency interference that occurs on the radio frequency spectrum. EMI references electromagnetic interference. “Both man-made and natural sources generate changing electrical currents and voltages that can cause EMI: ignition systems, a cellular network of mobile phones, lightning, solar flares, and auroras Northern/Southern Lights.” There are applications where you may want to leverage these signals and times when you may not want them. You’ll want to work with your cable assembly creator to figure out what is best for you. Moulded Cable Assemblies,
HDMI cables are typically moulded cable assemblies. Below you can find an image of an HDMI cable underneath the moulded shell. Moulded assemblies are typically used in applications where a more durable and finished appearance is desired so if those are your requirements, a moulded cable assembly may be the way to go. Assembled Coaxial Round, A Coaxial cable “is a type of electrical cable that has an inner conductor surrounded by a tubular insulating layer, surrounded by a tubular conducting shield. Many coaxial cables also have an insulating outer sheath or jacket. Flat Ribbon Cable Assemblies, Flat Ribbon cables look cool. Rather than the wires being bundled together within a sheath, the wires are nicely organized in a flat ribbon. Our full-service facility in Colorado manufactures custom cable and wire harnesses from prototype to final packaging, quickly and cost-effectively.

Our cable assembly manufacturer custom cables for specific applications based upon customer design and print requirements. We can assist with cable and connector selection, layout and manufacturing techniques, and computer-aided design (CAD). Our company can help you design your high-quality cable assembly to best suit your end product needs while keeping costs low. We have access to a wide cross-section of cables, connectors, application tooling, testing fixtures and adapters to meet industry and customers increasing demands for quality cable products. Our custom cable assembly solutions are manufactured for various applications in the medical, military, aerospace, and portable devices industries.
Our cable assembly engineers are invaluable members of the team. With detailed processes in place, the engineer can spell out project success from the start. The project schedule, indeed, is one of the most crucial parts of the planning process, as it will be in use at every step of the project. Our engineers help to judiciously set project schedules that allow us to meet whatever timetables are set by the client. A major contributing factor towards ensuring on-time delivery lies in Meridian’s UL approval as a manufacturing facility at both our US and China locations. Our clients and cable design engineers alike rely on a steady logistical operation, which has two wholly-owned manufacturing facilities on opposite ends of the globe readily facilitates. Our design engineers will work with you to design the most cost-efficient and reliable cable assembly for your application. Whether it’s a safety cable or restraint cable assembly, a control cable assembly, mechanical cable (push-pull cables or pull-pull cables), conductive cable (wiring harness or leads) medical miniature cable assembly or a remote actuation assembly, CMA can provide it.

Every custom cable assembly we produce is manufactured to the highest levels of quality. We use state-of-the-art production technology and proven processes to ensure superior quality, precision, and lot-to-lot uniformity. As needed, our in-house applications department can help your team optimize your design for ease of manufacturing or reduced production costs. Before starting full production, we can manufacture prototypes and/or first articles that enable you to test your cable assemblies’ form, fit, and function. Prototyping helps ensure perfect fitment and eliminate any confusion on your production line. We provide connector encapsulation with epoxy and polyurethane potting compounds and work with all types of electrical jacketed cables, whether unshielded or multi-shielded. Being an experienced electronic cable assemblies manufacturer, we understand the importance of cable assemblies in your machinery and ensure that they go through visual inspection as well as 100% electrical test with Cirrus testers to ensure minimum downtime and troubles. A key factor that distinguishes Star Engineering from other cable assembly companies is our in-house manufacturing capability. Our cable assembly solutions are manufactured for various industries like medical, automotive and manufacturing to name a few. We also provide customized solutions for electronic cable assemblies according to our customers. Contact us for the latest and the best in cable assemblies.

To discuss your business needs, please get in touch with our friendly customer service team or through our website, who will be happy to talk through your requirements.

title.rendered: PVC Wire And Cable, Types, Uses, Manufacture, Buying, a Guide

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]PVC wire and cable are not necessarily terms you might hear every day, but they are vital elements in the makeup of cable assemblies and other manufactured products. The usual mass of cables that manufacturers and prototype designers have to deal with is one of the main reasons why we provide neat, efficient and effective cable assemblies all over the globe!

But here, we’re going to provide some insight and information on what PVC wire and cables are, the various types and their uses. Plus much more.

But first, here’s the quick summary for you, then we’ll dive into more detail.

What Is PVC Wire And Cable? PVC wire and cable are where a thermoplastic material called Polyvinyl Chloride also referred to as PVC is used for wire insulation or cable jackets. PVC wires and cables are widely used due to excellent properties such as chemical, heat and water resistance, robustness, durability, and versatility.

The only specialty in PVC wires and cables is the insulation or sheathing material used. PVC is becoming a commonly used material for many wires and cable constructions recently.

Because of this, a variety of PVC wire and cable types are now available in the market to best suit customer needs. Let’s take a look at them in detail.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”375″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

PVC wire with Tin copper

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Types Of PVC Wires And Cables

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Below are some common types of PVC wires and cables that are available to suit different needs.

Special PVC Wires and Cables

Special PVC as the words says exhibits special properties for wire insulation and cable sheathing purposes.

The PVC used within special PVC wires and cables present very good electrical and mechanical characteristics compared to the average standard.

Also, this type of PVC cables and wires has good flexibility and strength to suit tough or complicated wiring/cabling needs. The temperature range of this type of PVC wires and cables is as follows.

  • Fixed Laying: -40ºC bis +70º C
  • Flexible Application: +5ºC bis +70 °C

Cold Resistant PVC

Cold-resistant PVC is known for its extreme cold resistance even at sub-zero temperatures. This type of cold-resistant PVC wires and cables exhibits some excellent mechanical strength and flexibility.

Nevertheless, it also shows good performance when exposed to various or extreme weather influences. The temperature range of this type of PVC wires and cables is as follows.

  • Fixed Laying: -40ºC bis +70º C
  • Flexible Application: -20ºC bis +70 °C

Heat Resistant PVC

This type of PVC wires and cables can resist extreme temperatures up to +105°C. The insulation and sheath materials used within this type possess excellent electrical and mechanical values to suit higher temperatures.

However, not many cables or wires of this type can bear a temperature beyond the maximum and if exposed beyond maximum temperature, it can reduce the usable life of the wire or the cable. The temperature range of this type of PVC wires and cables is as follows.

  • Fixed Laying: -40ºC bis +90º C
  • Flexible Application: +5 ºC bis +90 °C
  • Short time use: – bis+150 °C

Oil Resistant PVC

In this type of PVC cable and wires, the mixtures used are oil resistant. The mixture is mostly used as a sheath material in cables but can also be used in wires as insulation. The temperature range of this type of PVC wires and cables is as follows.

  • Fixed Laying: – 40ºC bis +70º C
  • Flexible Application: +5 ºC bis +70 °C

PVC can also be classified as inflammable because of its chemical composition. However certain elements may be released through a PVC wire or cable during a fire which is dangerous to humans, nature, buildings, and machines.

Now that you know the types of PVC wires and cables available, let’s take a look at their uses.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

PVC Wire and Cable Uses

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]PVC wires and cables are commonly used for home appliances, wiring of circuits, instruments, house wiring, mining operations, power supply solutions, submarines, ship wiring, etc. they’re even used in high temperature-sensitive environments like kitchen and related appliances.

The uses of PVC wires and cables come only from their properties. So it’s important to understand how certain properties of PVC wires and cables support different uses of PVC wires and cables. Below are five main properties of PVC wires and cables and how they contribute to certain uses.

 

  1. High versatility-One of the main uses of PVC wires and cables is its high versatility. The versatility has given PVC wires and cables extreme flexibility to be modified according to different requirements.
    They’re even recyclable and easy to modify using plasticizers and lubricants. This versatility has increased the use of PVC wires and cables in complicated industries.
  2. Extreme durability-PVC wires and cables are highly durable. This feature is similar to other copper wire types that are sturdy and robustly built and yet very supple.
    This has increased the usability of PVC wires and cables and their overall longevity. The durability also comes with another great use of resistance.  PVC wires and cables are resistant to corrosion, abrasion, chemical, and water most of the time. They’re also rustproof and offer shock absorption capabilities, which increases the durability even more.
  3. Safety-Another major use of PVC wires and cables is its safety. As we all know many wires and cables can become unsafe due to various reasons. Especially the weak resistance to any unexpected environmental conditions is always a concern in wires and cables.
    PVC cables and wires, however, have greater resistance increasing its suitability in sensitive environments such as kitchen and related appliances.
    This is because the material PVC in common is a highly dependable type of material which is odorless and non-toxic (suitable for food-related environments such as kitchens).
    Also, the heat, water, and chemical resistance have increased the usability of PVC wires and cables in kitchens and other similar environments even more.
  4. Customizable-The versatility and flexibility of PVC have made PVC wires and cables highly customizable. They can easily be molded into any shape or other preference. In fact, if you need PVC wires or products in bulk quantities you can easily customize them into any shape or size your business needs.
    PVC wires or cables are also cost-effective when you order in bulk quantities. This customizable feature has made PVC wires and cables easy to be used in household or convenient goods on a much large scale.
    Even the manufacturing industries largely use PVC wires and cables because of this customizability.  Commercial products such as electric motors, panel boards, control cables, and power transformers mainly use PVC wires or cables.
  5. Simple To Use– Another main use that comes with PVC wires and cables is the simplicity and easy-to-use features. This simplicity is again because of the highly versatile property that PVC cables and wires have, making it easy to use for any complicated need.
    The simplicity of use is also one of the reasons why PVC wires and cables are mainly used in home appliances. Easy to use also means PVC wires and cables can withstand rough usage. This is why PVC wires or cables do not damage or need to be replaced as often – because of their high strength.

Let’s take a look then finally at the process involved in making PVC wires and cables.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

PVC Cable and Wire Manufacturing Process

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

The process involved in making PVC wires and cables is fairly simple and cost-effective because it’s been refined over a long period of time. This is why PVC wires and cables are cheaper compared to other cables and wires.

 

The material PVC used in PVC wires and cables goes through a process called polymerization. This is where PVC is easily softened by heating making it highly versatile and giving all the flexible properties which PVC wires and cables are well known for.

 

This process also makes PVC wires and cables lightweight and reduces ‘dielectric losses’ and internal stress in electrical applications – making it easily usable within any appliances or any industry. However, the strength, longevity, and durability of cables and wires remain unchanged by this process.

 

To Conclude

We hope this has been useful in understanding how PVC cable and wires are made, used, the types, along with the Pros and Cons of their use. If you’re ready to begin including these and other components in your cable assembly, then you may need to give us a call for some advice and to see where we can assist your project. So get in touch now and we’ll be happy to help.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title.rendered: What Is Thermocouple Wire? Lengths, Types, and Uses, an Overview

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Wires are continuing to impacts our daily lives and how things work in an office environment. There are many different types of wires used within a basic USB cable to an advanced network cable that we don’t see. Thermocouple wire is one of these wires that many of us are unaware of.

What Is Thermocouple Wire? Thermocouple wire or cable is used within a thermocouple that senses temperature using the point of cold junction compensation. Thermocouple wire is used to control instrumentation and for building the sensing point in a thermocouple and is made out of two dissimilar metals.

To start off on this topic, let’s begin with one common question many have when it comes to wires, which is the length.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3559″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Overmolded Thermocouple cable

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Usable Lengths of Thermocouple Wire

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]There are many factors that impact the usable length of a thermocouple. The two main factors that affect the usable length of thermocouple wire are total loop resistance and electrical noise.

Thermocouple wires are made of different conductor materials. Because of this, the total loop resistance varies from based on the type as well as the wire diameter and length. However, the main goal for a usable length of thermocouple wire is to keep the loop resistance under 100 ohms.

With the other factor, the longer the wire, the higher the possibilities of it getting influenced by electrical/radiated noise. This long length of the wire will then affect the performance of the wire. As such the usable length of thermocouple wire is recommended not to run or exceed a minimum of 10 feet.

And in case the wire is extended it is recommended to use a shield to reduce the noise interference to an acceptable level. For this purpose, a metal over brad or twisted shielded wire can be used. At the same time avoid running wires closer to sensitive areas like motors and power wires.

All in all, the recommended goal for a usable wire length is to keep the wire reduced to less than 100 feet with 20 AWG or thicker wire in an area free of electromagnetic interference. Now with the recommended lengths defined, let’s get into the types of thermocouple wires available and how they differ.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Types of Thermocouple Wire

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The are many different types of thermocouples that are available to suit different measuring applications such as industrial, scientific, food temperature, medical research, etc. It is, in fact, the different types of thermocouple wires that enable thermocouples to suit different applications.

So to understand this better the thermocouple wire types are listed below with the positive electrode first, followed by the negative electrode.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

1.    Positive Electrode Thermocouple Wire Types

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  • Type K

Made out of Chromel (Nickel-Chromium Alloy) / Alumel (Nickel-Aluminium Alloy), type K thermocouple wires are the most commonly used for general purposes. It has a temperature range of −200 °C to +1200 °C and a sensitivity of 41 μV/°C. It is also comparatively inexpensive to other types of thermocouple wires.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3561″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

K type Fiber glass braided thermocouple wire

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type E

Made out of Chromel / Constantan (Copper-Nickel Alloy), type E thermocouple wire has a high sensitivity of (68 μV/°C). This type is well suited for cryogenic use (Those that has to deal with very low temperature). Cryogenic uses include food preservation, rocket fuels, and transport of liquefied gases and so on.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type J

Made out of Iron / Constantan, this type is used in old equipment that finds it difficult to accept modern thermocouples. It has a temperature range of limited −40 to +750 °C with a sensitivity about 52 μV/°C. This type when used above 760 °C which can cause permanent de-calibration and can also prevent its use in some applications.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3564″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Type J thermocouple wire

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type N

Made out of Nicrosil (Nickel-Chromium-Silicon Alloy) / Nisil (Nickel-Silicon Alloy, this type has high stability and resistance to high-temperature oxidation. This makes type N suitable for high-temperature measurements. Their temperature range can rise above 1200 °C with a sensitivity of about 39 μV/°C at 900°C.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3562″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Type N thermocouple wire

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

2.    Negative Electrode Thermocouple Wire Types

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type T

Made out of Copper / Constantan, type T has a temperature range of −200 to 350 °C with a sensitivity of 43 μV/°C. Both the conductors in type T are non-magnetic. Because of this, type T is an ideal choice for applications like electrical generators that has strong magnetic fields.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3563″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Type T thermocouple wire

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type B

Made out of Platinum 30% Rhodium / Platinum 6% Rhodium, type B thermocouple wires are suitable for high-temperature measurements up to 1800 °C. Because of their temperature-voltage curve, type B thermocouple wires has given its output at 0 °C and 42 °C.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type R

Made out of Platinum 13% Rhodium / Platinum, type R thermocouple wires are also suitable for high-temperature measurements up to 1600 °C. However, they are expensive and have a low sensitivity of about 10 μV/°C. This makes them unsuitable for general purpose use.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type S

Made out of Platinum 10% Rhodium / Platinum, Type S is also suitable for high-temperature measurements up to 1600 °C. Like type R, type S also has a low sensitivity of about 10 μV/°C and is not suitable for general purpose use. Type S is however used as is used as the standard of calibration for the melting point of gold (1064.43 °C), because of its high stability.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3572″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type C

Made out of Tungsten 5% Rhenium / Tungsten 26% Rhenium, type C has a temperature range of 32 to 4208°F ((0 to 2320°C). Type T is highly suitable for measurements of high temperature such as for vacuum furnaces at extremely high temperatures. However, type C must never be used around oxygen at temperatures above 500°F.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

  • Type M

Made out of Nickel Alloy 19 / Nickel-Molybdenum Alloy 20, with a temperature limited to 2500°F (~1400°C). This type is suitable to be used in the vacuum furnaces.

Clearly, the types of thermocouple wires directly decide the ability and performance of a thermocouple. In simple terms, the type of thermocouple wire decides how well a thermocouple can measure the temperature depending on your expectations.

And to sum up, let’s looks at some uses of thermocouple wires.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Uses of Thermocouple Wires

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]As we said thermocouple sensors are used to measure the temperature in various environments. So it’s important for an engineer to understand the differences between these thermocouple wires and their characteristics appropriately.

Only the wire will decide how effectively the sensor can be used to measure the temperature. It is, in fact, the wire and the material it is made out of that gives the sensor the ability to be used appropriately in different environments.

On a single view, the uses of thermocouple sensors are directly the uses of the thermocouple wires. This is because thermocouple wires are the essential element that enables a thermocouple sensor to work the way they do.

However specifically, thermocouple wires are used in many industrial, scientific and OEM applications. They’re also used in all industrial market such as Power Generation, Oil/Gas, Pharmaceutical, BioTech, Cement, Paper & Pulp, etc. Thermocouple wires are also used in daily appliances like toasters, stoves, and furnaces.

So thermocouple wires are continuing to deliver many uses from our work to daily lives applications. These wires have also simplified the use of sensing devices, mainly by matching different types of wires to best suit the need or expectation.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

To Finish

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]We hope this has provided a good overview of Thermocouple wire. If you have any questions about thermocouple wires, their types and their uses, or need assistance with anything injection molding related projects you have in mind, then please contact us for more help and information.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title.rendered: What Is A Cable Assembly, The Process, and 5 Common Cable Harness

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]One of the most significant elements of an electronic or electrical system is the cable assembly. But still, it is one of the last components that is addressed or given importance to. In fact, an over or under designed cable assembly will have a tremendous negative consequence in the performance of the electronic system.

What Is A Cable Assembly? Cable assembly is a group of wires or cables that are organized and integrated into a single unit. Cable assembly is primarily used to transmit power, signals, and information to the designated application and to provide cables protection. Cable assembly also makes an application easy to use, repair and maintain.

A cable assembly is also known as wiring looms or cable harness. You will be able to find cable assemblies of various sizes, colors, lengths, and sizes depending on the application. Anyway to give you a more detailed view on this topic I have an interesting flow of subheadings below.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3537″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Cable assembly & Harness

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

How It Works

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]As we might know electronic devices and applications deal with many cables that are often overwhelming to maintain. Think of an instance where the cables are tangled and the pain to untangle them. This can even cause disruptions in the flow of signals and power. So what a cable assembly does is bring the different cable components in an application or device to a single unit in a neat and well-organized manner. This will prevent the cables from getting all over the place and make it easier to use and maintain.

In addition, rough usage of cables and other unpredictable weather conditions can easily damage cables and disrupt their functioning. So under a cable assembly, all the cables are neatly bundled in an extremely durable sheet of material of exterior covering. This will thereby act as a protective layer for all the cables and its overall functionality. Likewise, a cable assembly also protects the cables from external environment uncertainties, easy wear, and tear and other rough usages.

Now that we know how it works,  let’s see how it’s made.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

How Its Made

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Cable assemblies are manufactured using outer sheaths that protect the cables from the external environment. Especially it protects the cables from ultraviolet radiations, moisture, oil, heat, fire, and cold. At the same times, the outer sheaths make the cables resistant to any plethora condition. In fact, what is great about cable assemblies is that it can withstand any major unpredictable environmental conditions.

Most of the cable assemblies are made out of recyclable and environmentally friendly materials. One of the beneficial things about how a cable assembly is made is that they have an extensive range of connectors and terminals. This extensive range of terminals and connectors can be used for controlling input, output, data and electrical current in an effective and efficient manner.

While this is the usual way how a cable assembly is made, they can also be custom-made. Custom made cable assembly address specific challenges and specification of devices and environments such as fire, moist, dust, friction, chemical and temperature exposure, flexibility and so on. The customization can also extend to desired shapes, sizes and colors.

So if the cable assembly option that your device may require is complex, you will need to specify it to an expert or any other specialized organizations and get it customized.

Now if you’re already shopping for cable assemblies and find it challenging to get hold of one, let me help you. I’ve compiled five of the most common cable assembly types. One of these could be the one you’re looking for to suit your device or application. Or, you could just Email us and we can help with your requirements.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

5 Common Cable Assembly Types

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Before I begin, it’s worth noting that these are just a few common cable assembly types which are also used or searched for frequently. However, there are many other types of cable assemblies which can range from simple to complex designs.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Military Grade Cable Assemblies

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]As the name implies, these are cable assemblies focused on aerospace, tactical and marine applications. Military grade cable assemblies need to be met with tough requirements and specifications. There’s even a separate set of requirements that need to be met with the connectors and wires that will be used in military graded cable assemblies. This is because the purpose of military graded cable assembly is to be suitable for rough and unpredictable environments.

These type of cable assemblies are used for fields of communication links, military ground equipment, inter-shelter communications, and remote weapon control, marine and airborne systems. So as you can see, these cable assemblies needed for underwater environments are totally different from military graded cable assemblies.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3539″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Millitary cablings

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

RFI/EMI Shielded Cable Assemblies

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]We’re living in an extremely electrically noisy world, and believe it or not, each of your cables is also adding to that noise. Yes, cables also get affected by EMI (electromagnetic interference) or RFI (radio frequency interference). These interferences cause several disruptions within the electrical system of your device.

For example, you may experience loss of data, poor signal quality, degraded performance or even completely ceasing the functions of your device. So the best way to eliminate this is to opt for an RF/EMI shielding for your cable assemblies.

There are two main types of shielding options available such as foil and braided shielding. Foil shielding attempts to cover the entire conductor of a cable assembly. Braided shielding, on the other hand, weaves copper into a mesh and surrounds the entire conductor. Likewise, braided shielding gives more protection from the interferences – but are more expensive. To decide which shielding option is the best for your device and the environment, get in contact with an interconnection solutions partner like QL-Custom.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3541″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Overmolded Magnetic

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Molded Cable Assemblies

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Molded cable assemblies are something that we come across in our non-work life. The best example is an HDMI cable. This is a type of cable assembly is typically used when you prefer a simple, and more appealing and finished appearance in your applications.

Molded shells are used for this type of cable assembly and they are made from either plastic or metal. They can also be shielded or unshielded and can be conveniently used in a variety of applications.

Lear more about molded cable see our Molded cable blog[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Assembled Coaxial Round Cable Assemblies

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Coaxial cables are a type of cable assembly where it has an inner conductor surrounded by a tubular insulating layer and a tubular conducting shield. They also have an insulating outer sheath or jacket.

This is something you can easily find in your TV cables (The thick black cables behind your TV that you always try to hide away!). These are mostly used in cable internet and other applications in vehicles, medical equipment, and radios.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

RF coaxial cable

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Flat Ribbon Cable Assemblies

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]As the name suggests, these are wired bundles and neatly organized into a single unit in a flat ribbon. They are large with wires or conductors running parallel to each other. They also have different colors coded for each wire. This helps to identify what exactly each wire does and identify them individually for easy maintenance.

These types of cables are perfect for use where cables requiring greater width. But their shape also enables them to be folded into space-saving configurations.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”3538″ img_size=”full”][vc_column_text]

Flat ribbon cable

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Reaching the end it is important to remember that these days there are many types of cable assemblies for a wealth of different applications. In Fact, cable assembling can also be done manually in a cost-effective manner. However, they may need a great level of understanding and days or weeks to finish, depending on the complexity of the design, so it’s a good idea to.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title.rendered: Electrical Wire Harness Design Basics, Steps, Common Mistakes, Advice

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Electrical wire harness designing is possibly one of the significant steps which allow any electrical device to work, especially helping a vehicle to work the way it is meant to. In fact, the success of an application and its relationship with wires and the overall flow of current is all anchored to how well a wiring harness is designed.

What is a wire harness? A set Wire harness is the assembly of wires or electrical cables to transmit signals or electric power. The wires are bound by a durable material such as nylon tie in the assembly process. It’s the wire harness that ensures the reliability of effective energy and information transmission in an application.

So there’s plenty more we can tell you about wire harnesses, but in the article, we’re going to give you a basic overview, the steps to guide you on design and construction.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Where Wire Harness Assemblies Are Used

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Wire harness assemblies are used in a multitude of different environments. The motor industry, aerospace, military applications, consumer products, and even for home projects. Many of these applications will contain multiple wire assembly harness installations and many are integral to enable the machine, vehicle or product to work effectively.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”3525″ img_size=”full” image_hovers=”false”][vc_column_text]

Automotive wiring

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”3527″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center” image_hovers=”false”][vc_column_text]

Millitary Cabling

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”3526″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center” image_hovers=”false”][vc_column_text]

Electronic Manufacturing

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

When Wire Harness Assemblies Should Be Installed

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Wire harness assemblies are used in a multitude of projects that contain and rely on a variety of wires and cables that function to complete different tasks. The challenge for most cable installations is that the cables and wires themselves are difficult to organize and keep straight and neat. A wire harness assembly can keep things better organized and help the project and installation install more easily and for the whole unit to run more smoothly.

However, wire harness designing needs to go through certain basic steps and processes. It’s only through this the effective functioning of the application can be ensured. So let me guide you with some electrical wire harness design basics.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Electric Wire Harness Design Focus

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]As we all know design is mostly created to solve a specific purpose or outcome, to ensure the right output is generated. Likewise, an electrical wire harness is designed to ensure the right wiring structure to assist a device in functioning the way it is expected to.

Wire harnesses specifically focus on two significant elements such as geometric and electrical. Identifying these two are extremely important to conduct and execute an effective wire harness design.

Geometrical focus tries to identify the specific space in which the wire harness design needs to be fixed. This will help identify if the harness design needs to cater to a larger or smaller network of electrical wiring.

The second focus is on identifying the potential electrical shortages that could happen with the design. For this purpose, the design will focus on the specific electrical guidelines that have to be met along with the design. This will ensure the wires are protected both from internal and external damages from electrical issues.

However, as an all cases, wire harness design will focus mainly on the reliability, function, and efficiency of the product, rather than the art. Also conveniently you have two option for a wire harness design.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Wiring Desgin LED display

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Electric Wire Harness Design Options

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]There is plenty of electric wire harness design software applications in the market which have automated the designing process. But harness designing can also be manually designed with proper understanding and skill. There’s are also plenty of organizations that can custom design wire harnesses to meet complicated environments and specifications.

So if you’re here to find out how to design your own wiring harness by yourself, let me fill you in on the details, to fulfill your requirements why not come and talk to us about your designs.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Wiring Design System

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Things You Need to Design an Electrical Wire Harness

The following are some of the basic things you’ll need to custom design your very own wire harness or to help instruct us on your requirements.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  1.    Wire Cutters– These are used to cut the wire to desired length and specifications of the design.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Cutting and stripping machine

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  1.    Wire Strippers– These are used to strip off parts of insulation cable when necessary.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Stripping Cable jacket machine

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  1.    Crimping Plier/Ratcheting Crimpers– These are used for tightening the terminals to the stripped wires.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Half automatic crimping machine

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  1.    Wires and Cabling– These are needed to create the flow of signal/ power to the expected terminal

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

  1.    Cable or Zip Ties– These help in bundling the wire harness neatly.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Cable zip ties

 

With these things ready, it’s only a matter of executing the wiring harness diagram. For this, you’ll need to create a wiring diagram that will guide you on measuring wires, cutting and stripping wires, binding the cables, etc.

In the next section, you’ll know what a wiring harness diagram is.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Designing a Wire Harness Diagram

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]A wire harness diagram is a physical layout of the connection you’re trying to create for the vehicle or any other intended application. A wiring harness diagram is different from a schematic diagram. It makes use of abstract symbols to represent the components of a connection.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Automotive Wiring Harness Diagrams

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]An ideal wiring harness diagram will have symbolized components, optimum positioning, splice positions, and wire colours. This will help differentiate the different points that need to go into the wiring process. The appearance of the diagram is a typical representation of how the wire bundling will ultimately look like.

In fact from the appearance of the diagram, you can decide how complicated or how pure your custom wire harness will be.

If you find it difficult to create a wiring diagram for your application, you can consult an expert for this purpose. Also, remember the success of an electric wire harness design will only depend on the wiring harness diagram. So it’s important to ensure the wiring harness diagram is accurately designed before execution.

Once the diagram is designed you can then start focusing on the process required to execute it with the above-mentioned things ready. So now let’s see the basic process for executing a wire harness diagram.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Basic Wiring Harness Design Process

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]The following are the basic three steps required to design a wiring harness with the things mentioned above.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Step One

With the diagram in hand, the required wires are cut as per the diagram. This is usually done using a special machine to be accurate on the numbers. However, you can also use a wire cutter for this purpose. Then after the wires are stripped exposing the core of the wire using a wire stripper. The core of the wire will be usually metallic in nature and is fitted into the connector housings, also known as crimping.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Step Two

The next thing to be done is clamping of the wires as specified by the diagram. You can make use of a crimping plier/ratcheting crimpers for this purpose. This is usually done on special workbench or pin board. After clamping the wire, the collections can be fastened with cable ties, zip ties or tapes and fitted into necessary cable components as per the diagram. The assembly of the design process is now complete and this can be directly fitted into the device of use.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Step Three

The final step is to test the functionality and efficiency of the wiring harness. This can be done with the help of a test board. Each of the primary wires can be tested individually or as a collection. If the test doesn’t give the expected output, there will be a need to realign the wire design or structuring until the expected output is given.

These days, all these steps are conducted in an automated manner. So, without some expertise, attempting to do it manually yourself means you might well make mistakes. So to avoid them, keep reading and find out what could go wrong.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Mistakes to Avoid in Electrical Wiring Harness Design

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Sometimes the wire harness design might not work in the way you expect it to. This is mainly because the wire harnessing diagram is not appropriately designed. Apart from this, the following are a few other possible mistakes of electric wire harness design.

  1.    Cutting the wires too short which then fails proper connections onthe entire cable harness.
  2.    Failing to identify the right signal, workflows and other functional or analytical requirements of the intended connection.
  3.    Not implementing the planned design as it is, or bringing amendments or adjustments to the design while executing.
  4.    Failing to standardize the design according to accepted electrical or manufacturing standards. Although this may not cause a defect in the harness it may frequently cause errors leading to financial costs.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Finding the Right Wire Harness Assembly Partner for Your Project

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]It’s important to remember that this provides a very basic overview and understanding of how an electric wire and cable harness design is laid out and executed.

Some applications may require complex designs and approaches. So it’s always better to understand the nature of the design and then move forward with an expert harness designer and a manufacturer that can implement the whole project alongside you.

Here at QL-Custom, We specialize in wire harness assemblies for every kind of task out there. From custom products that meet your exact specifications through to a large selection of pre-made merchandise. We can help advise you the correct options for you, so get in touch now, we’ll be happy to help.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
